text: Daniel Théodore Schlumberger (19 December 1904 - 21 October 1972Daniel Schlumberger Institut français du Proche-Orient) was a French archaeologist and Professor of Near Eastern Archaeology at the University of Strasbourg and later Princeton University. ==Biography== After having been invited by Khan Nasher in the 1960s, he conducted fieldwork at Ay Khanum in Afghanistan as Director of the Délégation Archéologique Française, discovering ruins and artifacts of the Hellenistic period.Answers.com. (2010). Daniel Schlumberger (Obituary: The Times, 25 October 1972). Retrieved on 2010-04-18. His written works were included posthumously in The Cambridge History of Iran (1983).
